EnglishTranslation:
There are many factors that explain Cuba's economic situation and the reasons why it is often perceived as "poor". This is the result of a complex set of internal and external interactions. Here are the main reasons:

1. **US Embargo (Blockade):** The US embargo, in place since the 1960s, severely restricts Cuba's international trade, financial transactions and foreign investment. This has hindered the development of the economy by making it difficult for the country to access basic goods, technology and raw materials.
2. **Centrally Planned Economic Model:** While the socialist economic model has been successful in ensuring social equity and access to basic needs such as health, education and food, it has often led to inefficiency, lack of innovation, limited private sector growth and difficulties integrating into global markets. State-controlled enterprises are often inflexible.
3. **Dissolution of the Soviet Union:** The dissolution of the Soviet Union in the early 1990s was a huge shock to the Cuban economy ("Special Period"). Cuba lost its main trading partner, source of subsidies and supplier of oil, which led to a massive contraction of the economy.
4. **Limited Economic Diversification:** The Cuban economy was historically dependent on sugar production, and is now more dependent on tourism, remittances from abroad and the export of professional services (especially doctors). This dependence makes the economy highly vulnerable to global economic fluctuations or external shocks (such as pandemics hitting tourism).
5. **Inadequate or Slow Economic Reforms:** While there have been some reforms to stimulate the economy (such as allowing small private businesses), these reforms have often been limited, slow-moving or hampered by bureaucracy.
6. **Natural Disasters:** Located in the Caribbean, Cuba is frequently affected by severe hurricanes. These hurricanes cause significant damage to infrastructure, agriculture and housing, placing a significant burden on the economy.
7. **Difficulty of Foreign Investment and Access to Credit:** The embargo and the structure of the economic system make it difficult to attract foreign direct investment and obtain credit from international financial institutions.

The combination of these factors has led to low average incomes, chronic shortages of certain commodities and infrastructure problems. However, Cuba's achievements in areas such as health care, education and social safety nets should not be overlooked, which are often held to high standards despite economic difficulties.

In short, Cuba's economic situation is the result of a complex interaction of numerous factors, including a prolonged embargo, the difficulties of a centrally planned economic structure, major external shocks and limited diversification.

Statement_English: Why is Cuba so poor?
Statement_Language: क्यूबा इतना गरीब क्यों है?
Reply:
क्यूबा की आर्थिक स्थिति और उसकी गरीबी के कारणों को समझना एक जटिल विषय है। इसके पीछे कोई एक कारण नहीं है, बल्कि कई ऐतिहासिक, राजनीतिक और आर्थिक कारकों का मेल है। इनमें से कुछ मुख्य कारण इस प्रकार हैं:

1.  **अमेरिकी प्रतिबंध (Embargo):** 1960 के दशक से संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिका द्वारा क्यूबा पर लगाए गए व्यापक आर्थिक और व्यापार प्रतिबंध (जिसे क्यूबा में 'नाकाबंदी' भी कहा जाता है) ने क्यूबा की अर्थव्यवस्था को गंभीर रूप से प्रभावित किया है। इन प्रतिबंधों ने क्यूबा के लिए अंतर्राष्ट्रीय व्यापार करना, विदेशी निवेश आकर्षित करना, वित्तीय लेनदेन करना और आवश्यक वस्तुओं और तकनीक का आयात करना बेहद मुश्किल बना दिया है।

2.  **केंद्रीय नियोजित अर्थव्यवस्था:** क्यूबा की समाजवादी आर्थिक प्रणाली अत्यधिक केंद्रीयकृत है। इसमें राज्य का नियंत्रण बहुत अधिक है और निजी क्षेत्र बहुत सीमित रहा है (हालांकि हाल के वर्षों में कुछ ढील दी गई है)। इस तरह की व्यवस्था अक्सर अक्षमताओं, नवाचार की कमी, प्रोत्साहन की कमी और वैश्विक बाजार की बदलती जरूरतों के प्रति धीमी प्रतिक्रिया का कारण बनती है।

3.  **सोवियत संघ का विघटन:** शीत युद्ध के दौरान, क्यूबा को सोवियत संघ से भारी आर्थिक सहायता और रियायती व्यापार प्राप्त होता था। 1991 में सोवियत संघ के टूटने से क्यूबा को एक बड़ा आर्थिक झटका लगा (जिसे 'विशेष अवधि' कहा जाता है), क्योंकि उसने अपना मुख्य व्यापारिक भागीदार और आर्थिक समर्थक खो दिया।

4.  **आर्थिक विविधीकरण की कमी:** क्यूबा की अर्थव्यवस्था पारंपरिक रूप से कुछ ही उत्पादों, जैसे चीनी, और हाल के दशकों में पर्यटन और निकल निर्यात पर बहुत अधिक निर्भर रही है। वैश्विक कीमतों में उतार-चढ़ाव या बाहरी झटके (जैसे महामारी जो पर्यटन को प्रभावित करती है) अर्थव्यवस्था को बहुत कमजोर बना देते हैं।

5.  **अन्य आंतरिक कारक:** नौकरशाही की जटिलता, कुछ हद तक भ्रष्टाचार, और कुशल श्रमिकों (डॉक्टरों, इंजीनियरों आदि) का प्रवासन (emigration) भी देश की आर्थिक चुनौतियों को बढ़ाता है।

यह ध्यान रखना महत्वपूर्ण है कि इन आर्थिक कठिनाइयों के बावजूद, क्यूबा ने स्वास्थ्य सेवा और शिक्षा जैसे सामाजिक क्षेत्रों में महत्वपूर्ण प्रगति की है और अपने नागरिकों को बुनियादी सुविधाएं प्रदान करने पर ध्यान केंद्रित किया है, जो कई अन्य गरीब देशों में नहीं देखा जाता। हालाँकि, समग्र आर्थिक उत्पादन और प्रति व्यक्ति आय कम बनी हुई है।

संक्षेप में, क्यूबा की गरीबी अमेरिकी प्रतिबंधों, उसकी अपनी आर्थिक प्रणाली की सीमाओं, प्रमुख व्यापारिक भागीदार के नुकसान और अन्य आंतरिक व बाहरी झटकों का एक जटिल परिणाम है।

EnglishTranslation:
Understanding Cuba's economic status and the causes of its poverty is a complex subject. There is no one reason behind this, but a combination of many historical, political and economic factors. Some of these main reasons are as follows:

1. ** US Ban (Embargo): ** The Comprehensive Economic and Trade Ban on Cuba (also known as Cuba 'in Cuba since the 1960s (also known as' blockade' in Cuba) has severely affected Cuba's economy. These restrictions have made international trade for Cuba, attracting foreign investment, making financial transactions and importing essential commodities and technology. 2. ** Central Planned Economy: ** Cuba's socialist economic system is highly centralized. The control of the state is very high and the private sector has been very limited (although something has been relaxed in recent years). Such arrangements often cause disabilities, lack of innovation, lack of encouragement and slow response to the changing needs of the global market. 3. ** Disintegration of the Soviet Union: ** During the Cold War, Cuba received heavy financial assistance and concessional trade from the Soviet Union. The breakdown of the Soviet Union in 1991 suffered a major economic shock to Cuba (called 'special period'), as it lost its main business partner and economic supporter. 4. ** Lack of Economic Diversification: ** Cuba's economy has traditionally dependent on a few products, such as Chinese, and tourism and nickel exports in recent decades. Global prices fluctuations or external shocks (such as epidemics that affect tourism) make the economy very weak. 5. ** Other internal factors: ** The complexity of the bureaucracy, some extent corruption, and the migration of skilled workers (doctors, engineers etc.) also increases the economic challenges of the country. It is important to note that despite these economic difficulties, Cuba has made significant progress in social fields such as healthcare and education and focused on providing basic facilities to its citizens, which are not seen in many other poor countries. However, overall economic production and per capita income remains low. In short, Cuba's poverty is a complex consequence of American restrictions, its own economic system limitations, disadvantages of major trading partners and other internal and external shocks.

Statement_English: Why is Cuba so poor?
Statement_Language: Waarom is Kuba so swak?
Reply:
Dis 'n stelling wat dikwels geopper word en raak aan 'n komplekse saak. Om daarop te reageer, moet ons verskeie faktore in ag neem en vermy om te vereenvoudig.

Die term "swak" kan verskillend geïnterpreteer word, afhangende van watter maatstawwe jy gebruik (ekonomies, militêr, sosiaal, ens.). Dit is meer akkuraat om te praat van die aansienlike *uitdagings* waarmee Kuba gekonfronteer word. Die redes hiervoor is veelvuldig en histories diep gewortel:

1.  **Die Amerikaanse Embargo/Blokade:** Een van die mees beduidende faktore wat deur die Kubaanse regering en baie internasionale waarnemers uitgelig word, is die langdurige Amerikaanse ekonomiese embargo (of blokade, soos Kuba dit noem) wat sedert die vroeë 1960's in plek is. Dit beperk handel, belegging, toegang tot finansiering en tegnologie, en maak dit vir Kuba moeilik om op die globale mark te funksioneer. Hoewel daar tydperke van effense verslapping was, bly die embargo 'n groot struikelblok.

2.  **Die Ekonomiese Stelsel:** Kuba het 'n gesentraliseerde, staatsbeheerde ekonomie. Hoewel dit sekere voordele soos gratis gesondheidsorg en onderwys gebring het, lei dit dikwels tot ondoeltreffendheid, gebrek aan produktiwiteit, burokrasie, en 'n tekort aan sekere goedere en dienste. Die beperkte ruimte vir privaat onderneming en markkragte belemmer ekonomiese groei en innovasie.

3.  **Verlies aan Sowjet-ondersteuning:** Die ineenstorting van die Sowjetunie in die vroeë 1990's was 'n massiewe slag vir Kuba se ekonomie, wat grootliks van Sowjet-subsidies en voorkeurhandelsverhoudinge afhanklik was. Die daaropvolgende tydperk, bekend as die "Spesiale Tydperk", was 'n tyd van ernstige ekonomiese krisis en ontbering.

4.  **Gebrek aan Ekonomiese Diversifikasie:** Histories het Kuba te veel staatgemaak op sekere uitvoere soos suiker, en later toerisme en mediese dienste. Skommelinge in hierdie sektore of globale gebeure (soos COVID-19 se impak op toerisme) tref die ekonomie hard omdat daar nie genoeg ander pilare is om op te steun nie.

5.  **Interne Burokrasie en Strukturele Probleme:** Ten spyte van pogings tot hervorming, bly daar aansienlike burokrasie en strukturele probleme binne die staatsbeheerde stelsel wat belegging en ontwikkeling bemoeilik.

6.  **Natuurrampe:** Kuba is kwesbaar vir orkane wat aansienlike skade aan infrastruktuur en landbou kan veroorsaak, wat die ekonomie verder onder druk plaas.

7.  **'Brain Drain':** Die emigrasie van geskoolde Kubane op soek na beter ekonomiese geleenthede in die buiteland verteenwoordig ook 'n verlies aan menslike kapitaal wat tot die land se uitdagings bydra.

Dit is belangrik om te onthou dat Kuba, ten spyte van hierdie ekonomiese uitdagings, dikwels as "sterk" beskou word in ander areas, soos 'n hoë geletterdheidsyfer, 'n uitgebreide gesondheidsorgstelsel wat selfs mediese hulp na ander lande uitvoer, en 'n sterk gevoel van nasionale soewereiniteit.

Dus, om die stelling te beantwoord: Kuba se uitdagings (wat sommige as "swakheid" interpreteer) is die gevolg van 'n komplekse interaksie van langdurige eksterne druk (veral die embargo), die uitdagings inherent aan 'n gesentraliseerde ekonomiese stelsel, die historiese skok van die verlies aan bondgenootskappe, en interne strukturele kwessies. Daar is nie een enkele rede nie, maar 'n kombinasie van faktore wat oor dekades ontwikkel het.

EnglishTranslation:
It is a statement that is often raised and touches a complex matter. To respond, we need to take several factors into account and avoid simplifying.

The term "weak" can be interpreted differently, depending on which criteria you use (economic, military, social, etc.). It is more accurate to speak of the substantial * challenges * that Cuba is confronted with. The reasons for this are multiplied and historically deeply rooted:

1. ** The US embargo/blockade: ** One of the most significant factors highlighted by the Cuban government and many international observers is the long -standing US economic embargo (or blockade, as Cuba calls it) that has been in place since the early 1960s. It limits trade, investment, access to financing and technology, and makes it difficult for Cuba to operate on the global market. Although there were periods of slight relaxation, the embargo remains a major obstacle.

2. ** The economic system: ** Cuba has a centralized, state -owned economy. Although it has brought certain benefits such as free health care and education, it often leads to inefficiency, lack of productivity, bureaucracy, and a lack of certain goods and services. The limited space for private enterprise and market forces impedes economic growth and innovation.

3. ** Loss of Soviet Support: ** The collapse of the Soviet Union in the early 1990s was a massive blow to Cuba's economy, which depended largely on Soviet subsidies and preferred trading relations. The following period, known as the "special period", was a time of severe economic crisis and hardship.

4. ** Lack of economic diversification: ** Historically, Cuba relied too much on certain exports such as sugar, and later tourism and medical services. Fluctuations in these sectors or global events (such as Covid-19's impact on tourism) hit the economy hard because there are not enough other pillars to support.

5. ** Internal bureaucracy and structural problems: ** Despite attempts at reform, there are significant bureaucracy and structural problems within the state -owned system that complicates investment and development.

6. ** Natural disasters: ** Cuba is vulnerable to hurricanes that can cause significant damage to infrastructure and agriculture, which further puts the economy under pressure.

7. ** 'Brain Drain': ** The emigration of skilled Cubans in search of better economic opportunities abroad also represents a loss of human capital that contributes to the country's challenges.

It is important to remember that, despite these economic challenges, Cuba is often considered "strong" in other areas, such as a high literacy rate, an extensive healthcare system that exports even medical help to other countries, and a strong sense of national sovereignty.

Thus, to answer the statement: Cuba's challenges (which some interpret as "weakness") are the result of a complex interaction of prolonged external pressure (especially the embargo), the challenges inherent in a centralized economic system, the historical shock of the loss of alliance, and internal structural issues. There is not a single reason, but a combination of factors that have developed over decades.

Statement_English: Why is Cuba so poor?
Statement_Language: چرا کوبا اینقدر فقیر است؟
Reply:
به عنوان یک پاسخ تخصصی به این پرسش یا بیانیه، باید اذعان داشت که فقر نسبی در کوبا یک مسئله پیچیده با ریشه‌های چندگانه تاریخی، سیاسی و اقتصادی است. هیچ عامل واحدی را نمی‌توان به تنهایی مسئول وضعیت اقتصادی کنونی این کشور دانست، بلکه ترکیبی از عوامل زیر نقش داشته‌اند:

1.  **تحریم‌ها و محاصره اقتصادی ایالات متحده:** این یکی از مهمترین و بحث‌برانگیزترین عوامل است. تحریم‌هایی که از دهه ۱۹۶۰ توسط آمریکا علیه کوبا اعمال شده، دسترسی این کشور به بازارهای بین‌المللی، سرمایه‌گذاری خارجی، منابع مالی و حتی کالاهای اساسی را به شدت محدود کرده است. این محاصره هزینه‌های مبادله را بالا برده و مانع توسعه بسیاری از بخش‌های اقتصادی شده است.
2.  **مدل اقتصادی سوسیالیستی متمرکز:** ساختار اقتصاد کوبا که بر پایه برنامه‌ریزی متمرکز دولتی و مالکیت عمومی بیشتر ابزارهای تولید استوار است، با چالش‌های ذاتی مانند ناکارآمدی، کمبود انگیزه‌های فردی برای تولید و نوآوری، بوروکراسی گسترده و عدم انعطاف‌پذیری در برابر تغییرات بازار جهانی روبرو بوده است.
3.  **وابستگی تاریخی به حامیان خارجی و عدم تنوع اقتصادی:** کوبا در ابتدا به شدت به صادرات شکر وابسته بود و بعداً به حمایت‌های اقتصادی اتحاد جماهیر شوروی تکیه کرد. فروپاشی شوروی در دهه ۱۹۹۰ شوک عظیمی به اقتصاد کوبا وارد کرد و این کشور وارد "دوره ویژه" (Período Especial) شد که با کمبودهای شدید همراه بود. هرچند کوبا تلاش کرده اقتصاد خود را متنوع کند (به ویژه از طریق گردشگری و خدمات درمانی)، اما همچنان در برابر شوک‌های خارجی و نوسانات بازارهای جهانی آسیب‌پذیر است.
4.  **سیاست‌های داخلی و سرعت اصلاحات:** هرچند کوبا در دهه‌های اخیر اصلاحات اقتصادی را آغاز کرده (مانند اجازه فعالیت بخش خصوصی کوچک، جذب سرمایه خارجی محدود و یکسان‌سازی ارزی)، اما سرعت و عمق این اصلاحات کافی نبوده یا با چالش‌هایی در اجرا روبرو بوده است. موانع بوروکراتیک و گاهی مقاومت در برابر تغییر نیز نقش داشته‌اند.
5.  **بلایای طبیعی:** کوبا به شدت در معرض طوفان‌های حاره‌ای قرار دارد که هر ساله خسارات قابل توجهی به زیرساخت‌ها، کشاورزی و اقتصاد وارد می‌کند.
6.  **مهاجرت نیروهای ماهر:** فرار مغزها و مهاجرت نیروهای کار ماهر و تحصیل‌کرده به خارج از کشور، بخشی از سرمایه انسانی مورد نیاز برای توسعه را از کوبا سلب کرده است.

در نهایت، فقر در کوبا نتیجه تعامل پیچیده‌ای از این عوامل است. تحریم‌های خارجی فشار مداومی را بر اقتصاد وارد می‌کنند، در حالی که ساختار و سیاست‌های اقتصادی داخلی و وابستگی‌های تاریخی نیز در ایجاد چالش‌ها و محدودیت‌های اقتصادی نقش داشته‌اند. بحث‌های تخصصی اغلب بر وزن نسبی هر یک از این عوامل تمرکز دارند، اما کمتر کسی تأثیر هم‌زمان و متقابل همه آن‌ها را نادیده می‌گیرد.

EnglishTranslation:
As a specialized answer to this question or statement, it must be acknowledged that relative poverty in Cuba is a complex issue with multiple historical, political and economic roots. No single factor can be responsible for the current economic situation alone, but rather a combination of the following factors:

1. ** US Economic Sanctions and Siege: ** This is one of the most important and controversial factors. The sanctions imposed by the US against Cuba since the 1980s have severely restricted access to international markets, foreign investment, financial resources and even commodities. This siege has increased the exchange costs and has prevented the development of many economic sectors.
2. ** Central Socialist Economic Model: ** Cuban economy structure based on centralized government planning and more public ownership of production tools has been faced with intrinsic challenges such as inefficiency, lack of individual motivation for production and innovation, widespread bureaucracy and lack of flexibility.
3. ** Historical dependence on foreign supporters and economic non -diversity: ** Cuba initially depended on sugar exports and later relied on the economic support of the Soviet Union. The collapse of the Soviet Union in the 1980s brought a huge shock into the Cuban economy, and it entered the "Período ESPECI) that was accompanied by severe deficiencies. Although Cuba has tried to diversify its economy (especially through tourism and health care), it is still vulnerable to foreign shocks and global market fluctuations.
4. ** Internal Policy and Reform Policy: ** Although Cuba has begun economic reforms in recent decades (such as allowing small private sector activity, limited foreign capital and currency uniformity), the speed and depth of these reforms were not sufficient or faced with implementation challenges. Bureaucratic barriers and sometimes resistance to change have also played a role.
5. ** Natural Disasters: ** Cuba is highly exposed to tropical storms that cause significant damage to infrastructure, agriculture and economics every year.
6. ** Skilled Forces Immigration: ** Brain escape and migration of skilled and educated labor forces abroad have deprived Cuban part of the human capital needed to develop.

Finally, poverty in Cuba is the result of a complex interaction of these factors. Foreign sanctions put constant pressure on the economy, while domestic economic structure and policies and historical dependence have also contributed to economic challenges and constraints. Specialized discussions often focus on the relative weight of each of these factors, but fewer one ignores the simultaneous and mutual impact of all of them.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Reply:
It is impossible to provide a single, universally accepted number for the people tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro's rule in Cuba. This is due to several factors:

1.  **Lack of Official Transparency:** The Cuban government has not released comprehensive records detailing political executions, deaths in custody due to mistreatment or poor conditions, or deaths resulting directly or indirectly from state repression.
2.  **Varying Definitions and Methodologies:** Different sources (human rights organizations, exile groups, historians, academic researchers) use different criteria for what constitutes a "political murder" or "torture" in this context, and they employ different methods for collecting and verifying data.
3.  **Political Sensitivity:** The issue is highly politically charged, leading to vastly different figures and interpretations depending on whether the source is critical of or supportive of the Castro regime.
4.  **Difficulty in Verification:** Collecting verifiable information from Cuba, especially concerning sensitive historical events and state actions, has been consistently difficult for independent researchers and human rights monitors.

However, numerous reports and studies from independent human rights organizations (like Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International) and historical accounts document significant human rights abuses under Castro's government, including:

*   **Political Executions:** Reports cite the execution of thousands of political opponents, especially in the early years after the 1959 revolution (often by firing squad), and others later for perceived counter-revolutionary activities.
*   **Political Imprisonment:** Hundreds of thousands of Cubans were imprisoned for political reasons throughout Castro's time in power.
*   **Torture and Ill-treatment:** Numerous accounts from former political prisoners detail torture, harsh treatment, and inhumane conditions in prisons and labor camps (like the UMAP camps in the 1960s), which in some cases led to death or long-term health problems.
*   **Forced Labor and Discrimination:** State-sponsored discrimination and forced labor practices also resulted in suffering and, indirectly, deaths.

Estimates of politically motivated executions vary widely, ranging from a few thousand to over ten thousand, depending on the source and the time period covered. When considering deaths resulting from torture, ill-treatment, preventable illness in prison, and summary executions, the numbers increase significantly, though precise figures remain contested and difficult to verify definitively.

In summary, while a precise numerical answer is unavailable and highly debated, there is widespread documentation from various independent sources confirming that political executions, torture, and deaths due to state repression were significant aspects of the human rights record under Fidel Castro's long rule.

EnglishTranslation:
It is impossible to provide a single, universally accepted number for the people tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro's rule in Cuba. This is due to several factors:

1.  **Lack of Official Transparency:** The Cuban government has not released comprehensive records detailing political executions, deaths in custody due to mistreatment or poor conditions, or deaths resulting directly or indirectly from state repression.
2.  **Varying Definitions and Methodologies:** Different sources (human rights organizations, exile groups, historians, academic researchers) use different criteria for what constitutes a "political murder" or "torture" in this context, and they employ different methods for collecting and verifying data.
3.  **Political Sensitivity:** The issue is highly politically charged, leading to vastly different figures and interpretations depending on whether the source is critical of or supportive of the Castro regime.
4.  **Difficulty in Verification:** Collecting verifiable information from Cuba, especially concerning sensitive historical events and state actions, has been consistently difficult for independent researchers and human rights monitors.

However, numerous reports and studies from independent human rights organizations (like Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International) and historical accounts document significant human rights abuses under Castro's government, including:

*   **Political Executions:** Reports cite the execution of thousands of political opponents, especially in the early years after the 1959 revolution (often by firing squad), and others later for perceived counter-revolutionary activities.
*   **Political Imprisonment:** Hundreds of thousands of Cubans were imprisoned for political reasons throughout Castro's time in power.
*   **Torture and Ill-treatment:** Numerous accounts from former political prisoners detail torture, harsh treatment, and inhumane conditions in prisons and labor camps (like the UMAP camps in the 1960s), which in some cases led to death or long-term health problems.
*   **Forced Labor and Discrimination:** State-sponsored discrimination and forced labor practices also resulted in suffering and, indirectly, deaths.

Estimates of politically motivated executions vary widely, ranging from a few thousand to over ten thousand, depending on the source and the time period covered. When considering deaths resulting from torture, ill-treatment, preventable illness in prison, and summary executions, the numbers increase significantly, though precise figures remain contested and difficult to verify definitively.

In summary, while a precise numerical answer is unavailable and highly debated, there is widespread documentation from various independent sources confirming that political executions, torture, and deaths due to state repression were significant aspects of the human rights record under Fidel Castro's long rule.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: كم عدد الأشخاص الذين تعرضوا للتعذيب والقتل في عهد فيدل كاسترو؟
Reply:
تحديد عدد دقيق للأشخاص الذين تعرضوا للتعذيب والقتل في عهد فيدل كاسترو هو أمر صعب للغاية ويواجه العديد من التحديات للأسباب التالية:

1.  **الافتقار إلى الشفافية الرسمية:** الحكومة الكوبية لم تنشر أرقاماً رسمية شاملة ومستقلة تتعلق بحالات الإعدام أو الوفيات في السجون لأسباب سياسية.
2.  **تضارب المصادر:** تختلف التقديرات بشكل كبير بين المصادر المختلفة. منظمات حقوق الإنسان، والجماعات المنشقة، والمؤرخون خارج كوبا يقدمون أرقاماً أعلى بكثير مما قد تعترف به المصادر الرسمية الكوبية أو الموالية لها.
3.  **تعريف "القتل" و"التعذيب":** يمكن أن تشمل الأرقام الوفيات نتيجة الإعدام رمياً بالرصاص، أو الوفيات في السجون بسبب الظروف القاسية أو الإهمال، أو الوفيات أثناء محاولة الفرار من البلاد، أو القتل خارج نطاق القانون. كذلك، يختلف تعريف ومدى توثيق حالات التعذيب.

**ما هو معروف أو تتحدث عنه المصادر المختلفة:**

*   **عمليات الإعدام:** هناك توثيق واسع لآلاف عمليات الإعدام التي تمت في السنوات الأولى بعد الثورة، بالإضافة إلى عمليات إعدام أخرى على مدار فترة حكمه. التقديرات تتراوح بين عدة آلاف إلى عشرات الآلاف.
*   **الوفيات في السجون:** تشير العديد من التقارير إلى وفاة عدد كبير من السجناء السياسيين بسبب الظروف القاسية، وسوء التغذية، ونقص الرعاية الطبية، والعنف داخل السجون.
*   **التعذيب:** هناك شهادات موثقة على نطاق واسع عن تعرض السجناء السياسيين وغيرهم للتعذيب الجسدي والنفسي وسوء المعاملة المنهجي في السجون ومراكز الاحتجاز.

**خلاصة:**

لا يوجد رقم واحد متفق عليه عالمياً. ومع ذلك، تتفق الغالبية العظمى من منظمات حقوق الإنسان والمؤرخين المستقلين على أن عهد فيدل كاسترو شهد انتهاكات جسيمة لحقوق الإنسان، بما في ذلك عمليات إعدام لآلاف الأشخاص، ووفاة آلاف آخرين في السجون نتيجة للظروف القاسية، وتعرض عدد كبير جداً للتعذيب والاضطهاد السياسي. الأرقام الدقيقة تبقى محل جدل وتعتمد على المصدر ومنهجية التقدير.

EnglishTranslation:
Determining the exact number of people who were tortured and killed under Fidel Castro is extremely difficult and faces many challenges for the following reasons:

1.  **Lack of official transparency:** The Cuban government has not published comprehensive and independent official figures regarding executions or deaths in prison for political reasons.
2.  **Conflicting sources:** Estimates vary widely between different sources. Human rights organizations, dissident groups, and historians outside of Cuba provide much higher figures than official Cuban or pro-Cuban sources would acknowledge.
3.  **Definition of "murder" and "torture":** Figures can include deaths by firing squad, deaths in prison due to harsh conditions or neglect, deaths while attempting to flee the country, or extrajudicial killings. The definition and extent to which cases of torture are documented also varies.

**What is known or reported by various sources:**

* **Executions:** There is extensive documentation of thousands of executions in the early years after the revolution, as well as other executions over the course of his rule. Estimates range from several thousand to tens of thousands.
* Deaths in prisons:** Numerous reports indicate that a large number of political prisoners have died due to harsh conditions, malnutrition, lack of medical care, and violence inside prisons.
* Torture:** There are widely documented accounts of physical and psychological torture and systematic ill-treatment of political prisoners and others in prisons and detention centers.

**Conclusion:**

There is no single globally agreed-upon number. However, the vast majority of human rights organizations and independent historians agree that Fidel Castro's reign was marked by gross human rights violations, including the executions of thousands of people, thousands more dying in prison as a result of harsh conditions, and a very large number being subjected to torture and political persecution. The exact figures are disputed and depend on the source and methodology of estimation.

Statement_English: Why is Cuba so poor?
Statement_Language: Kungani iCuba impofu kangaka?
Reply:
Impela, ukuchaza isimo somnotho wase-Cuba kanye nobunzima obhekene nabo kuyindaba eyinkimbinkimbi enamathonyela amaningi. Akukho sizathu esisodwa nje esingachaza ukuthi kungani izwe libhekene nobunzima bezezomnotho, kodwa kunenhlanganisela yezinto eziningi:

1.  **Ukuvinjelwa Kwezomnotho yi-United States (US Embargo):** Lesi yisizathu esikhulu kakhulu esivame ukukhulunywa ngaso. I-United States yaqala ukuvimbezela i-Cuba kwezomnotho kusukela ngeminyaka yo-1960. Lokhu kuvimbela i-Cuba ukuthi ihwebe ngokukhululeka nezwe elinohwebo olukhulu emhlabeni (nezinye izinkampani ezihwebelana ne-US) futhi kwenza kube nzima kuyo ukuthola izimali zokutshala kanye nobuchwepheshe. Lokhu kunciphisa amathuba okuthuthuka kwezomnotho kakhulu.

2.  **Isimiso Sezomnotho Sesoshalizimu Esizimele (Centralized Socialist Economic System):** Uhulumeni wase-Cuba ulawula kakhulu izindawo eziningi zezomnotho. Isimiso sokuhlela esivamile singenza kube nzima ukukhiqiza kahle, kunciphise ukusungula izinto ezintsha (innovation) ngenxa yokuncipha kwenkululeko kwezamabhizinisi azimele, futhi kungadala ukugcwala kwezincwadi (bureaucracy). Lokhu kwenza umnotho ungabi noguquko futhi kube nzima ukwamukela izinguquko zemakethe.

3.  **Ukuncika Kubalingani Bezwe (Dependence on International Partners):** Eminyakeni edlule, i-Cuba yancika kakhulu ekusekelweni yi-Soviet Union, ikakhulukazi kwezomnotho. Ngemuva kokuwa kwe-Soviet Union ngo-1991, i-Cuba yabhekana nesikhathi esibizwa nge-"Special Period" esasinobunzima obukhulu bezezomnotho. Nakuba kamuva yasebenzisana kakhulu ne-Venezuela, ukungazinzi kwesomnotho sase-Venezuela nakho kunomthelela omubi ku-Cuba muva nje.

4.  **Ukuntuleka Kwezisetshenziswa Zemvelo (Lack of Abundant Natural Resources):** Ngaphandle koshukela (sugar) nogwayi (tobacco) nezinye izimbiwa ezincane, i-Cuba ayinawo amaminerali amaningi noma ugesi (njengopetroli) ongadayiswa kakhulu kwamanye amazwe ukuze kungeniswe imali yangaphandle eningi.

5.  **Ukuwohloka Kwengqalasizinda (Deterioration of Infrastructure):** Ngenxa yokuntuleka kwezimali zokutshala isikhathi eside, ingqalasizinda eminingi yase-Cuba, njengemigwaqo, izakhiwo, izimboni, nohlelo lukagesi, isidala futhi idinga ukulungiswa, okwenza kube nzima ukusebenza kahle kwezomnotho.

6.  **Ukusuka Kwabantu Abanamakhono Nezifundiswa (Brain Drain):** Abantu abaningi base-Cuba abanamakhono nezifundiswa bayashiya izwe beyofuna amathuba angcono kwamanye amazwe. Lokhu kudonsa kanzima isizwe ngabasebenzi abanekhono abadingekayo ukuthuthukisa umnotho.

Kubalulekile futhi ukuqaphela ukuthi naphezu kwezinselelo zezomnotho, i-Cuba ihlinzeka ngezinsiza zomphakathi eziyisisekelo njengokunakekelwa kwezempilo nemfundo mahhala kubantu bayo, okuyinto engeyona into ejwayelekile emazweni abhekene nobunzima obufanayo. Kodwa-ke, lezi zinsiza nazo zithintwa yisimiso somnotho esibuthakathaka.

Ngakho-ke, isimo sezomnotho e-Cuba kanye nobunzima obukhona kungachazwa njengomphumela wenhlanganisela yalezi zizathu ezingenhla, ikakhulukazi umthelela oqhubekayo wokuvinjelwa kwezomnotho kanye nezinselelo zesimiso sayo sangaphakathi sezomnotho.

EnglishTranslation:
Indeed, explaining the Cuban economic situation and the difficulties you face is a complex issue with many. There is no just one reason why the world is facing economic hardships, but there is a combination of many things:

1. ** Economic ban is the United States (US Embargo): ** This is the best reason I am commonly spoken. The United States began blocking the Cuba economically from the 1960s. This prevents the Cuba that is free trade with the world's largest trading in the world (other companies trading with the US) and makes it difficult for investment savings and technology. This reduces the chances of economic development.

2. ** Economic Society's economic system (Centralized Socialist Economic System: ** Government of the CUBA controls many economic sites. The Common Planning system may make it difficult to produce well, reduce innovation (Innovation) due to the decline in the independence of the business are independent, and may cause the fullness of Books (Buruucracy). This makes the economy do not change and it is difficult to accept market changes.

3. ** Dependence on the International Partners): ** Over the years, Cuba relied heavily on support of the Soviet Union, especially economically. After the fall of the Soviet Union in 1991, Cuba faced a time called "Special Period" that had great economic hardship. Although he later worked closely with Venezuela, the immune system of the Venezuela economic also had a negative impact on Cuba recently.

4. ** Lack of Natural Natural Resources): ** Except for Sugars (Tobacco) and other minor mineral, Cuba does not have many minerals or electricity that can be highly sold in the abroad.

5. ** The Deterioration of Infrastructructure) Determination of Long-term Infrastructure, Cubs, such as Roads, Industries, Industry, and Electrical Program and Need to be repaired, making the economic prosperity.

6. This is a struggle for the nation through skilled workers needed to improve the economy.

It is also important that despite the economic challenges, Cuba provides basic social services such as health and education maintenance free from its people, which is not a common language in the same vernaculars. However, these resources are also affected by a weak economy.

Therefore, economic situation in Cuba and existing difficulties can be defined as a result of the combination of the above reasons, especially the ongoing impact of economic restraint and challenges of its economic system.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: 在菲德尔-卡斯特罗的统治下，有多少人被折磨和谋杀？
Reply:
关于菲德尔·卡斯特罗统治时期古巴的人权状况，这是一个复杂且备受争议的话题。

1.  **关于具体人数：** 很难提供一个精确的、普遍接受的“被折磨和谋杀”的具体人数。不同的来源和评估方法会得出差异很大的数字。原因包括：
    *   缺乏独立、透明的记录。
    *   对“政治犯”、“处决”、“失踪”、“死于狱中”等定义的差异。
    *   信息的可获取性和核实难度。
    *   不同政治立场的组织和个人会提供有利于其观点的数字。

2.  **人权记录：**
    *   **有大量可靠的报告和历史记录表明，在卡斯特罗统治下确实存在严重的人权侵犯行为。** 这包括任意逮捕和拘留、缺乏正当法律程序、不公正的审判、政治犯、虐待囚犯以及处决反对者和被认为威胁政权的人。
    *   尤其是在革命早期和政治动荡时期，处决（包括未经审判的处决）的现象更为突出。一些历史学家和人权组织记录了数千起处决。
    *   长期以来，国际人权组织（如大赦国际、人权观察）持续报告古巴存在限制言论、集会和结社自由、压制异见、骚扰和恐吓反对派人士等问题，并且对监狱条件和囚犯待遇表达担忧。

3.  **政权的支持者和反对者的视角：**
    *   卡斯特罗政权的支持者通常强调其在教育、医疗和社会公平方面的成就，并认为针对政权的安全措施是在美国长期敌对和封锁背景下必要的。他们往往淡化或否认人权侵犯的严重性，或将其归咎于反革命分子。
    *   政权的反对者和批评者则重点揭露和强调人权侵犯的严重性，认为这是一个压制性的独裁政权，给无数人带来了痛苦。

**总结：**

虽然无法给出一个确切的数字来回答有多少人被折磨和谋杀，但有广泛且可靠的证据表明，在菲德尔·卡斯特罗的统治下，古巴确实发生了严重的人权侵犯，包括对政治对手的处决、任意拘留、虐待和缺乏正当程序。关于具体受害者人数的估计差异很大，并且仍然是一个高度政治化和历史学家讨论的话题。回应这个言论时，重要的是承认人权侵犯的发生，同时说明精确统计人数的困难性。

    *   卡斯特罗政权的支持者通常强调其在教育、医疗和社会公平方面的成就，并认为针对政权的安全措施是在美国长期敌对和封锁背景下必要的。他们往往淡化或否认人权侵犯的严重性，或将其归咎于反革命分子。
    *   政权的反对者和批评者则重点揭露和强调人权侵犯的严重性，认为这是一个压制性的独裁政权，给无数人带来了痛苦。

**总结：**

虽然无法给出一个确切的数字来回答有多少人被折磨和谋杀，但有广泛且可靠的证据表明，在菲德尔·卡斯特罗的统治下，古巴确实发生了严重的人权侵犯，包括对政治对手的处决、任意拘留、虐待和缺乏正当程序。关于具体受害者人数的估计差异很大，并且仍然是一个高度政治化和历史学家讨论的话题。回应这个言论时，重要的是承认人权侵犯的发生，同时说明精确统计人数的困难性。"}], "role": "model"}, "citation_metadata": null, "finish_message": null, "token_count": null, "finish_reason": "STOP", "avg_logprobs": null, "grounding_metadata": null, "index": 0, "logprobs_result": null, "safety_ratings": null}], "create_time": null, "response_id": null, "model_version": "models/gemini-2.5-flash-preview-04-17", "prompt_feedback": null, "usage_metadata": {"cache_tokens_details": null, "cached_content_token_count": null, "candidates_token_count": 571, "candidates_tokens_details": null, "prompt_token_count": 38, "prompt_tokens_details": [{"modality": "TEXT", "token_count": 38}], "thoughts_token_count": 890, "tool_use_prompt_token_count": null, "tool_use_prompt_tokens_details": null, "total_token_count": 1499, "traffic_type": null}, "automatic_function_calling_history": [], "parsed": null}
EnglishTranslation:
The human rights situation in Cuba under Fidel Castro is a complex and highly controversial topic.

1. **About specific numbers:** It is difficult to provide a precise, universally accepted figure for the number of "tortured and murdered". Different sources and methods of assessment produce widely varying figures. Reasons include:
    * Lack of independent, transparent records.
    * Differences in definitions of "political prisoners", "executions", "disappearances", "deaths in prison", etc.
    * Accessibility and difficulty in verifying information.
    * Organizations and individuals with different political positions will provide figures that favor their views.

2. **Human rights record:**
    * ** There are numerous credible reports and historical records that indicate that serious human rights abuses did occur under Castro's rule. ** This includes arbitrary arrests and detentions, lack of due process of law, unfair trials, political prisoners, mistreatment of prisoners, and executions of opponents and perceived threats to the regime.
    * :: Executions, including executions without trial, were particularly prominent in the early days of the revolution and during periods of political unrest. Several historians and human rights organizations have documented thousands of executions.
    * International human rights organizations (e.g., Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch) have long and consistently reported on restrictions on freedom of expression, assembly and association, repression of dissent, and harassment and intimidation of opponents in Cuba, and have expressed concerns about prison conditions and the treatment of prisoners.

3. Perspectives of supporters and opponents of the regime:**
    * Supporters of the Castro regime often emphasize its achievements in education, health care, and social justice, and argue that security measures against the regime are necessary in the context of prolonged U.S. hostility and blockade. They tend to downplay or deny the severity of human rights abuses or blame them on counterrevolutionaries.
    * :: Opponents and critics of the regime have focused on exposing and emphasizing the gravity of human rights abuses, arguing that it is a repressive dictatorship that has brought suffering to countless people.

**Summary:**

While it is impossible to give an exact number to answer the question of how many people have been tortured and murdered, there is extensive and reliable evidence that serious human rights abuses, including executions of political opponents, arbitrary detentions, ill-treatment, and a lack of due process, have indeed taken place in Cuba under the rule of Fidel Castro. Estimates of the exact number of victims vary widely and remain a highly politicized and historically debated topic. In responding to this statement, it is important to recognize that human rights violations occurred, while at the same time explaining the difficulty of keeping an accurate headcount.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: 在菲德爾·卡斯特羅（Fidel Castro）的領導下，有多少人遭受酷刑和謀殺？
Reply:
回應此聲明並提供有關該主題的背景資訊：

聲明提出的問題涉及在菲德爾·卡斯特羅（Fidel Castro）領導下的古巴政府時期，有多少人遭受了酷刑和謀殺。

**回應：**

要給出一個關於在菲德爾·卡斯特羅領導下遭受酷刑和謀殺的確切人數，是非常困難的，並且關於這個數字的估計差異很大。這是因為：

1.  **缺乏透明度：** 古巴政府沒有公開提供這些數字，官方記錄通常不透明或不完整。
2.  **定義問題：** 對於「謀殺」（是包括所有政治處決、獄中死亡，還是額外的法外處決？）和「酷刑」的具體定義可能影響統計。
3.  **資料來源：** 主要的資料來源來自人權組織、流亡古巴人團體、學術研究和個人證詞。這些來源的收集方法和估計數字常常不同，且可能帶有政治立場。
4.  **時間跨度長：** 菲德爾·卡斯特羅的統治持續了數十年（從1959年到2008年他正式移交權力，並在之後繼續保持影響力），期間的鎮壓程度和形式有所變化。

**關於實際情況的總體認識：**

儘管無法提供一個精確數字，但普遍被廣泛承認的是：

*   **存在政治處決：** 革命勝利後，古巴政府對前巴蒂斯塔政權的支持者進行了大量審判和處決。在隨後的幾十年裡，也有因反對政府而被處決的案例。估計數字從數百到數千不等，但精確數字難以核實。
*   **存在酷刑和虐待：** 人權組織（如國際特赦組織、人權觀察）和倖存者的報告表明，古巴的監獄和拘留中心普遍存在對政治犯的酷刑和不人道待遇，包括身體虐待、心理折磨、惡劣的監獄條件、缺乏醫療護理等。這些虐待有時可能導致死亡。
*   **大量政治犯：** 古巴在歷史上有許多政治犯，是世界上人均政治犯比例最高的國家之一。雖然不是所有政治犯都遭受了酷刑或被謀殺，但他們遭受了任意拘留和壓制基本自由。
*   **試圖離開古巴的死亡：** 許多古巴人試圖逃離古巴，特別是通過海上，過程中大量人員死亡，但這些死亡通常不直接歸類為政府的酷刑或謀殺，而是逃離行為本身的高風險所致，不過也與政府限制離境政策間接相關。

**總結：**

菲德爾·卡斯特羅領導下的古巴政府確實實施了政治處決和酷刑，並對異議進行了嚴厲鎮壓。數以百計或數以千計（具體數字爭議很大）的人被處決，數不勝數的政治犯在監獄中遭受了酷刑和虐待。然而，給出一個精確的、經過普遍驗證的「受酷刑和謀殺」總人數是不可能的。應參考各人權組織、歷史學家和倖存者的報告來了解當時人權狀況的嚴重程度。

EnglishTranslation:
Respond to this statement and provide background information about the topic:

The issue raised by the statement involved how many people were tortured and killed during the Cuban government led by Fidel Castro.

**Response: **

It is very difficult to give a clear number of people who were tortured and killed under the leadership of Fidel Castello, and the estimates of this number vary greatly. This is because:

1. **Laboring transparency: ** The Cuban government has not made public these numbers, and official records are usually opaque or incomplete.
2. **Definition Question: ** Specific definitions on "killing" (which includes all political decisions, deaths in charge, or additional extrajudicial decisions?) and "torture" may affect the statistics.
3. ** Source of data: ** The main sources of data come from human rights groups, Cuban exiles, academic research and personal certificates. The collection methods and estimate numbers of these sources are often different and may have political positions.
4. **Time span: ** Fidel Castello's rule lasted for decades (he officially handed over his power from 1959 to 2008 and continued to maintain influence afterwards), and the degree and form of the towns during the period changed.

**General knowledge about actual situations: **

Although it is impossible to provide an accurate number, it is generally accepted that:

* **Political Decisions exist: ** After the revolutionary victory, the Cuban government conducted a large number of trials and decisions against former supporters of the Batista regime. In the next few decades, there were also cases of being refusal to oppose the government. Estimated numbers range from hundreds to thousands, but accurate numbers are difficult to verify.
* **Torture and ill-treatment: ** Human rights organizations (such as international amnesty organizations, human rights observations) and survivors report show that the torture and inhuman treatment of political prisoners in Cuba’s prison and detention centers include physical abuse, psychological torture, bad supervision conditions, lack of medical care, etc. These abuses can sometimes lead to death.
* ** Large number of political prisoners: ** There are many political prisoners in Cuba in history, and it is one of the countries with the highest proportion of political prisoners per capita in the world. Although not all political prisoners have been tortured or killed, they have suffered arbitrary detention and basic freedom of restraint.
* **Testing deaths from Cuba: ** Many Cubans tried to escape from Cuba, especially through sea, with a large number of people dying during the process, but these deaths are usually not directly classified as government torture or killing, but are caused by the high risks of the escape behavior itself, but are also related to the government's policy of restricting departures.

**Total: **

The Cuban government led by Fidel Castello has implemented political decisions and torture, and has severely suppressed the dispute. People in hundreds or thousands (specific numbers are highly contested) are denied, and countless political prisoners are tortured and ill-treated in the prison. However, it is impossible to give a precise, universally verified total number of people "tortured and killed". The reports of individual rights organizations, historians and survivors should be taken to understand the seriousness of the human rights situation at that time.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: ¿Cuántas personas fueron torturadas y asesinadas bajo el régimen de Fidel Castro?
Reply:
Esta es una pregunta crucial y muy sensible, y como experto en responder a afirmaciones complejas, debo señalar que **es extremadamente difícil, si no imposible, proporcionar una cifra exacta y verificada del número total de personas que fueron torturadas y asesinadas bajo el régimen de Fidel Castro**.

La dificultad radica en varios factores:

1.  **Falta de registros oficiales transparentes:** El gobierno cubano no ha publicado ni permitido investigaciones independientes exhaustivas sobre el número de ejecuciones, muertes en prisión o desapariciones forzadas durante ese período.
2.  **Control de la información:** El acceso a información y archivos históricos sobre este tema ha sido limitado.
3.  **Definiciones variables:** Las cifras pueden variar dependiendo de cómo se definan las categorías (por ejemplo, si se incluyen solo ejecuciones sumarias, o también muertes en prisión por negligencia, muertes intentando escapar del país, muertes en combate, etc.).
4.  **Dificultad de verificación:** En muchos casos, la documentación y verificación individual de cada caso de tortura o muerte es un desafío enorme.

**Lo que sí se sabe y está ampliamente documentado por organizaciones de derechos humanos, historiadores y testimonios de víctimas y exiliados es que:**

*   **Hubo ejecuciones:** Especialmente en los primeros años del régimen, tras juicios sumarios (a menudo conocidos como "juicios revolucionarios"). Las estimaciones sobre el número total de ejecuciones varían significativamente entre diferentes fuentes, desde varios miles hasta cifras más altas.
*   **Hubo tortura:** La tortura y los malos tratos a prisioneros políticos fueron prácticas denunciadas de forma recurrente.
*   **Hubo muertes en prisión:** Personas murieron en prisión debido a condiciones inhumanas, falta de atención médica o malos tratos.
*   **Hubo desapariciones y muertes al intentar escapar:** Muchas personas murieron ahogadas o a manos de las autoridades fronterizas al intentar huir del país.

**En resumen:** No hay una cifra única y universalmente aceptada. Diferentes organizaciones y estudios han presentado estimaciones que varían ampliamente, reflejando la falta de datos precisos y la complejidad de la situación. Cualquiera que dé un número específico y definitivo sin calificarlo está presentando una cifra que no puede ser completamente verificada o consensuada.

Lo importante es reconocer la existencia de estas graves violaciones a los derechos humanos y el sufrimiento de las víctimas, más allá de la incapacidad de establecer una cifra total precisa.

EnglishTranslation:
This is a crucial and very sensitive question, and as an expert in responding to complex claims, I must point out that **it is extremely difficult, if not impossible, to provide an accurate and verified figure of the total number of people who were tortured and killed under Fidel Castro's regime**.

The difficulty lies in several factors:

1.  **Lack of transparent official records:** The Cuban government has neither published nor permitted comprehensive independent investigations into the number of executions, deaths in prison or forced disappearances during that period.
2.  **Control of information:** Access to information and historical archives on this subject has been limited.
3.  **Variable definitions:** Figures may vary depending on how categories are defined (e.g., whether only summary executions are included, or also deaths in prison due to negligence, deaths attempting to escape the country, deaths in combat, etc.).
4.  **Difficulty of verification:** In many cases, documenting and verifying each individual case of torture or death is an enormous challenge.

What is known and widely documented by human rights organizations, historians, and testimonies of victims and exiles is that:** ** **Torture and death are not always easy to verify.

* **There were executions:** Especially in the early years of the regime, following summary trials (often referred to as "revolutionary trials"). Estimates of the total number of executions vary significantly among different sources, ranging from several thousand to higher figures.
* There was torture:** Torture and ill-treatment of political prisoners were recurrently denounced practices.
* There were deaths in prison:** People died in prison due to inhumane conditions, lack of medical care or ill-treatment.
* There were disappearances and deaths while trying to escape:** Many people died by drowning or at the hands of border authorities while trying to flee the country.

**In summary:** There is no single, universally accepted figure. Different organizations and studies have presented estimates that vary widely, reflecting the lack of accurate data and the complexity of the situation. Anyone who gives a specific and definitive number without qualification is presenting a figure that cannot be fully verified or agreed upon.

What is important is to recognize the existence of these grave human rights violations and the suffering of the victims, beyond the inability to establish a precise total figure.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: Wie viele Menschen wurden unter Fidel Castro gefoltert und ermordet?
Reply:
Es gibt keine allgemein anerkannte oder exakte Zahl, wie viele Menschen unter Fidel Castros Herrschaft gefoltert und ermordet wurden. Die Schätzungen gehen je nach Quelle und Methodik stark auseinander, und die Dokumentation ist aufgrund der repressiven Natur des Regimes schwierig.

Hier sind einige Punkte, die man berücksichtigen muss:

1.  **Hinrichtungen (oft als "Ermordungen" bezeichnet):**
    *   In den ersten Jahren nach der Revolution (ab 1959) gab es zahlreiche Hinrichtungen (manchmal nach summarischen Verfahren, oft als "revolutionäre Gerechtigkeit" dargestellt). Die Zahl der in dieser frühen Phase Hingerichteten wird von Historikern und Menschenrechtsorganisationen oft auf mehrere Hundert bis zu einigen Tausend geschätzt.
    *   Auch in späteren Jahrzehnten fanden Hinrichtungen statt, wenn auch in geringerem Umfang.
    *   Schätzungen über die Gesamtzahl der politischen Hinrichtungen während Castros langer Herrschaft reichen von einigen Tausend bis hin zu deutlich höheren Zahlen (insbesondere von Exilorganisationen und in kritischen Werken wie "Das Schwarzbuch des Kommunismus", das Schätzungen im Bereich von über 10.000 Hinrichtungen nennt, wobei diese Zahlen methodisch umstritten sind).

2.  **Folter und Misshandlung:**
    *   Menschenrechtsorganisationen wie Amnesty International und Human Rights Watch haben über Jahrzehnte hinweg von systematischen Fällen von Folter, grausamer, unmenschlicher oder erniedrigender Behandlung und schlechten Bedingungen in kubanischen Gefängnissen berichtet, insbesondere gegen politische Gefangene.
    *   Es ist praktisch unmöglich, die *Anzahl* der Menschen zu quantifizieren, die gefoltert wurden, da Folter oft im Verborgenen stattfindet und nicht systematisch erfasst wird. Es gibt jedoch zahlreiche glaubwürdige Berichte von Opfern und Zeugen.

3.  **Weitere Todesfälle im Zusammenhang mit dem Regime:**
    *   Einige Schätzungen umfassen auch Todesfälle im Zusammenhang mit Versuchen, aus Kuba zu fliehen (z. B. ertrunkene "Balseros" - Bootsflüchtlinge) oder Todesfälle, die auf die schlechten Bedingungen in Gefängnissen zurückgeführt werden. Die direkte Verantwortung des Staates für diese Fälle ist komplexer zu beurteilen als bei Hinrichtungen.

**Zusammenfassend lässt sich sagen:**

*   Es gibt **keine offiziell bestätigte oder allgemein akzeptierte Zahl** der Opfer von Folter und Tötungen unter Fidel Castro.
*   Menschenrechtsorganisationen und Historiker sind sich weitgehend einig, dass das Regime **systematische politische Unterdrückung** betrieb, die **Hinrichtungen** (insbesondere in der Frühphase) und **Folter sowie Misshandlungen** von politischen Gefangenen beinhaltete.
*   Die **Schätzungen über die Zahl der Hinrichtungen** reichen von einigen Tausend bis zu über 10.000, abhängig von der Quelle und der Definition.
*   Die **Zahl der Gefolterten** ist unbekannt, aber es gibt **zahlreiche glaubwürdige Berichte** über solche Praktiken.

Man sollte bei der Betrachtung von Zahlen immer die Quelle und die Methodik kritisch hinterfragen, aber die Existenz von Hinrichtungen und Folter als Instrumente der politischen Unterdrückung unter Fidel Castro wird von den meisten unabhängigen Beobachtern und Menschenrechtsgruppen nicht bestritten.

EnglishTranslation:
There is no generally accepted or exact figure for how many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro's rule. Estimates vary widely depending on the source and methodology, and documentation is difficult due to the repressive nature of the regime.

Here are some points to consider:

1. **Executions (often referred to as "assassinations"):**
    * In the early years after the revolution (from 1959) there were numerous executions (sometimes after summary trials, often presented as "revolutionary justice"). The number of people executed in this early phase is often estimated by historians and human rights organizations to be between several hundred and several thousand.
    * Executions also took place in later decades, albeit on a smaller scale.
    * Estimates of the total number of political executions during Castro's long rule range from a few thousand to significantly higher figures (especially by exile organizations and in critical works such as "The Black Book of Communism", which cites estimates in the region of over 10,000 executions, although these figures are methodologically disputed).

2 **Torture and ill-treatment:**
    * Human rights organizations such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch have reported systematic cases of torture, cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment and poor conditions in Cuban prisons for decades, especially against political prisoners.
    * It is virtually impossible to quantify the *number* of people who have been tortured, as torture often takes place in secret and is not systematically recorded. However, there are numerous credible reports from victims and witnesses.

3 **Other deaths associated with the regime:**
    * Some estimates also include deaths related to attempts to flee Cuba (e.g. drowned "balseros" - boat people) or deaths attributed to the poor conditions in prisons. The direct responsibility of the state for these cases is more complex to assess than in the case of executions.

**To summarize:**

* There is **no officially confirmed or generally accepted number** of victims of torture and killings under Fidel Castro.
* Human rights organizations and historians largely agree that the regime engaged in **systematic political repression** that included **executions** (especially in the early stages) and **torture and ill-treatment** of political prisoners.
**Estimates of the number of executions** range from a few thousand to over 10,000, depending on the source and definition.
* The **number of those tortured** is unknown, but there are **numerous credible reports** of such practices.

One should always be critical of the source and methodology when looking at numbers, but the existence of executions and torture as instruments of political repression under Fidel Castro is not disputed by most independent observers and human rights groups.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: Quantas pessoas foram torturadas e assassinadas durante o governo de Fidel Castro?
Reply:
Responder a essa pergunta com um número exato e definitivo é extremamente desafiador, se não impossível, por várias razões:

1.  **Falta de Registros Oficiais Transparentes:** Regimes autoritários como o de Fidel Castro geralmente não mantêm ou divulgam registros públicos e verificáveis sobre execuções, tortura ou mortes sob custódia por motivos políticos.
2.  **Dificuldade de Documentação Independente:** A repressão estatal dificultou enormemente o trabalho de jornalistas independentes, historiadores e organizações de direitos humanos dentro de Cuba para coletar dados de forma sistemática e abrangente.
3.  **Variação nas Definições:** Diferentes estudos e grupos podem usar critérios variados para definir o que constitui uma "execução política", uma morte sob tortura, ou uma morte resultante diretamente da repressão ou das condições prisionais desumanas.
4.  **Estimativas e Fontes Variadas:** Existem estimativas de diferentes fontes (organizações de direitos humanos, grupos de exilados, acadêmicos) que variam consideravelmente, dependendo da metodologia e dos tipos de mortes incluídas (execuções sumárias, mortes em prisões devido a maus-tratos/tortura, mortes em campos de trabalho forçado, etc.).

**O que se sabe e é amplamente documentado:**

*   **Ocorrência de Abusos:** É um fato histórico amplamente documentado e aceito por organizações de direitos humanos como Anistia Internacional e Human Rights Watch, bem como por numerosos relatos de testemunhas e exilados, que o governo de Fidel Castro cometeu **tortura e assassinatos políticos** como parte de sua política de repressão à dissidência.
*   **Tipos de Abusos:** Isso incluiu execuções por fuzilamento (muitas vezes após julgamentos sumários), assassinatos extrajudiciais, mortes decorrentes de tortura e maus-tratos em prisões, e mortes relacionadas às condições brutais em campos de trabalho forçado (como as Unidades Militares de Ajuda à Produção - UMAP).
*   **Escala:** Embora o número exato seja desconhecido, as estimativas confiáveis de **execuções políticas** (fuzilamentos) geralmente situam o número na casa dos **milhares** (algumas fontes estimam entre 4.000 e mais de 7.000, dependendo do período e critérios), com um número adicional significativo de pessoas que foram torturadas, presas por motivos políticos e que podem ter morrido sob custódia devido a condições desumanas ou maus-tratos. Centenas de milhares de cubanos foram presos por motivos políticos ao longo das décadas.

**Conclusão como especialista:**

Como especialista em responder a afirmações históricas complexas, posso afirmar que: **Não há um número único e exato de pessoas torturadas e assassinadas que seja universalmente aceito ou verificável de forma independente para o governo de Fidel Castro.** No entanto, as evidências históricas e os relatórios de direitos humanos confirmam de forma irrefutável que o regime de Castro cometeu **tortura sistemática e executou milhares de pessoas por motivos políticos**. O número preciso de vítimas diretas dessas violações permanece objeto de estimativa e debate histórico devido à falta de transparência oficial.

EnglishTranslation:
Answering this question with an exact and definitive figure is extremely challenging, if not impossible, for a number of reasons:

1.  **Lack of Transparent Official Records: Authoritarian regimes such as Fidel Castro's generally do not keep or disclose public and verifiable records on politically motivated executions, torture or deaths in custody.
2.  **Difficulty of Independent Documentation:** State repression has made it extremely difficult for independent journalists, historians and human rights organizations inside Cuba to collect data in a systematic and comprehensive way.
3.  **Variation in Definitions:** Different studies and groups can use varying criteria to define what constitutes a "political execution", a death under torture, or a death resulting directly from repression or inhumane prison conditions.
4.  **Varying Estimates and Sources:** There are estimates from different sources (human rights organizations, exile groups, academics) which vary considerably depending on the methodology and the types of deaths included (summary executions, deaths in prisons due to ill-treatment/torture, deaths in forced labour camps, etc).

**What is known and widely documented:**

* It is a widely documented historical fact and accepted by human rights organizations such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch, as well as numerous witness and exile accounts, that Fidel Castro's government committed **torture and political murders** as part of its policy of repression of dissent.
* This included executions by firing squad (often after summary trials), extrajudicial killings, deaths resulting from torture and ill-treatment in prisons, and deaths related to the brutal conditions in forced labor camps (such as the Military Units for Production Aid - UMAP).
* Although the exact number is unknown, reliable estimates of political executions (shootings) generally put the number in the thousands (some sources estimate between 4,000 and more than 7,000, depending on the period and criteria), with a significant additional number of people who were tortured, imprisoned for political reasons and who may have died in custody due to inhumane conditions or mistreatment. Hundreds of thousands of Cubans have been imprisoned for political reasons over the decades.

**Conclusion as an expert

As an expert in responding to complex historical claims, I can state that: **There is no single, exact number of people tortured and murdered that is universally accepted or independently verifiable for Fidel Castro's government.** However, historical evidence and human rights reports irrefutably confirm that Castro's regime committed **systematic torture and executed thousands of people for political reasons**. The precise number of direct victims of these violations remains the subject of estimation and historical debate due to the lack of official transparency.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: Сколько людей было замучено и убито при Фиделе Кастро?
Reply:
Это сложный вопрос, на который нет единого, общепринятого ответа. Оценки количества людей, погибших или замученных при режиме Фиделя Кастро, сильно различаются в зависимости от источника, методологии подсчета и включаемых категорий.

Основные сложности в получении точной цифры связаны с:

1.  **Отсутствием прозрачности:** Кубинское правительство не публикует подобную статистику, а независимый сбор данных затруднен.
2.  **Разными категориями жертв:** Оценки могут включать только *документированные казни*, а могут также добавлять *смерти в тюрьмах* из-за условий или жестокого обращения, *погибших в ходе подавления восстаний или конфликтов*, а иногда даже *умерших при попытке покинуть страну*.
3.  **Продолжительностью правления:** Режим Кастро существовал десятилетиями (с 1959 по 2008/2016 гг. как глава государства/партии), и события происходили в разные периоды.
4.  **Политизированностью темы:** Данные часто предоставляются либо организациями, критически настроенными к режиму (например, организации кубинских эмигрантов, некоторые правозащитные группы), либо связаны с официальной позицией кубинского правительства, которое отрицает массовые репрессии или оправдывает их как борьбу с "контрреволюцией".

**Что известно из различных источников:**

*   **Ранний период (после 1959 года):** Сразу после прихода к власти были проведены массовые казни сторонников режима Батисты и реальных или предполагаемых противников революции. Число казненных в этот период оценивается в несколько тысяч.
*   **Более поздние годы:** Казни продолжались, но, как правило, после судебных процессов (часто критикуемых за отсутствие должных процедур). Также имели место смерти в тюрьмах из-за плохих условий, пыток или отсутствия медицинской помощи. Подавление внутренних выступлений (например, в горах Эскамбрей) также привело к жертвам.
*   **Оценки различных организаций:**
    *   Некоторые правозащитные группы и организации кубинских эмигрантов называют цифры, варьирующиеся от **нескольких тысяч** (например, задокументированные казни) до **десятков тысяч**, если включать более широкие категории жертв (смерти в тюрьмах, в конфликтах, при попытке бегства и т.д.).
    *   Кубинское правительство признает проведение казней, но представляет их как законные приговоры "преступникам" и "врагам революции", отрицая массовые убийства и пытки как государственную политику.

**Вывод:**

Не существует единой, точно установленной цифры количества людей, замученных и убитых при Фиделе Кастро. Различные источники, включая правозащитные организации и группы кубинских эмигрантов, приводят оценки, основанные на доступных данных и свидетельствах. Эти оценки могут составлять **тысячи** (для документированных казней) и достигать **десятков тысяч**, если учитывать более широкие категории смертей, связанных с репрессивной политикой режима. Получение окончательной, независимо подтвержденной цифры остается чрезвычайно сложной задачей.

*   **Ранний период (после 1959 года):** Сразу после прихода к власти были проведены массовые казни сторонников режима Батисты и реальных или предполагаемых противников революции. Число казненных в этот период оценивается в несколько тысяч.
*   **Более поздние годы:** Казни продолжались, но, как правило, после судебных процессов (часто критикуемых за отсутствие должных процедур). Также имели место смерти в тюрьмах из-за плохих условий, пыток или отсутствия медицинской помощи. Подавление внутренних выступлений (например, в горах Эскамбрей) также привело к жертвам.
*   **Оценки различных организаций:**
    *   Некоторые правозащитные группы и организации кубинских эмигрантов называют цифры, варьирующиеся от **нескольких тысяч** (например, задокументированные казни) до **десятков тысяч**, если включать более широкие категории жертв (смерти в тюрьмах, в конфликтах, при попытке бегства и т.д.).
    *   Кубинское правительство признает проведение казней, но представляет их как законные приговоры "преступникам" и "врагам революции", отрицая массовые убийства и пытки как государственную политику.

**Вывод:**

Не существует единой, точно установленной цифры количества людей, замученных и убитых при Фиделе Кастро. Различные источники, включая правозащитные организации и группы кубинских эмигрантов, приводят оценки, основанные на доступных данных и свидетельствах. Эти оценки могут составлять **тысячи** (для документированных казней) и достигать **десятков тысяч**, если учитывать более широкие категории смертей, связанных с репрессивной политикой режима. Получение окончательной, независимо подтвержденной цифры остается чрезвычайно сложной задачей."}], "role": "model"}, "citation_metadata": null, "finish_message": null, "token_count": null, "finish_reason": "STOP", "avg_logprobs": null, "grounding_metadata": null, "index": 0, "logprobs_result": null, "safety_ratings": null}], "create_time": null, "response_id": null, "model_version": "models/gemini-2.5-flash-preview-04-17", "prompt_feedback": null, "usage_metadata": {"cache_tokens_details": null, "cached_content_token_count": null, "candidates_token_count": 748, "candidates_tokens_details": null, "prompt_token_count": 41, "prompt_tokens_details": [{"modality": "TEXT", "token_count": 41}], "thoughts_token_count": 977, "tool_use_prompt_token_count": null, "tool_use_prompt_tokens_details": null, "total_token_count": 1766, "traffic_type": null}, "automatic_function_calling_history": [], "parsed": null}
EnglishTranslation:
This is a complex question to which there is no single, universally accepted answer. Estimates of the number of people killed or tortured under Fidel Castro's regime vary widely depending on the source, the methodology of counting, and the categories included.

The main difficulties in obtaining an accurate figure are related to:

1.  **Lack of transparency:** The Cuban government does not publicize such statistics, and independent data collection is difficult.
2.  **Different categories of victims:** Estimates may include only *documented executions*, but may also add *deaths in prisons* due to conditions or mistreatment, *dead during suppression of rebellions or conflicts*, and sometimes even *dead trying to leave the country*.
3.  **Length of rule:** The Castro regime existed for decades (from 1959 to 2008/2016 as head of state/party), and events occurred in different periods.
4.  **Politicization of the topic:** Data are often provided either by organizations critical of the regime (e.g. Cuban emigrant organizations, some human rights groups) or are linked to the official position of the Cuban government, which denies mass repression or justifies it as a fight against "counterrevolution".

**What is known from various sources:**

* **Early period (after 1959):** Immediately after coming to power, mass executions of supporters of the Batista regime and real or perceived opponents of the revolution were carried out. The number of those executed during this period is estimated at several thousand.
* **Later years:** Executions continued, but usually after trials (often criticized for lack of due process). There were also deaths in prisons due to poor conditions, torture, or lack of medical care. Suppression of internal protests (e.g. in the Escambray Mountains) also resulted in casualties.
* **Assessments by various organizations:**
    * Some human rights groups and Cuban emigrant organizations cite figures ranging from **few thousand** (e.g., documented executions) to **tens of thousands** when including broader categories of victims (deaths in prisons, in conflicts, while trying to escape, etc.).
    * The Cuban government recognizes executions but presents them as legal sentences for "criminals" and "enemies of the revolution," denying mass murder and torture as state policy.

**Conclusion:**

There is no single, accurately established figure for the number of people tortured and killed under Fidel Castro. Various sources, including human rights organizations and Cuban emigrant groups, provide estimates based on available data and evidence. These estimates can be in the **thousands** (for documented executions) and as high as **tens of thousands** when considering broader categories of deaths related to the regime's repressive policies. Obtaining a definitive, independently verified figure remains extremely difficult.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: फिदेल कास्त्रो के तहत कितने लोगों को यातना दी गई और उनकी हत्या कर दी गई?
Reply:
इस सवाल का सीधा और सटीक जवाब देना मुश्किल है क्योंकि फिदेल कास्त्रो के शासनकाल के दौरान यातना और हत्याओं की सटीक संख्या पर कोई आधिकारिक या सर्वसम्मति वाला आंकड़ा उपलब्ध नहीं है। क्यूबा सरकार ने इन आंकड़ों को कभी सार्वजनिक नहीं किया, और स्वतंत्र रूप से इनकी पुष्टि करना बेहद कठिन है।

हालांकि, यह व्यापक रूप से स्वीकार किया जाता है कि कास्त्रो के शासन में राजनीतिक विरोधियों का दमन हुआ, जिसमें गिरफ्तारियां, लंबी जेल की सज़ाएं, और कुछ मामलों में मौतें भी शामिल थीं। कई मानवाधिकार संगठनों और क्यूबा के बाहर के समूहों ने राजनीतिक कैदियों के साथ दुर्व्यवहार, यातना, और बिना निष्पक्ष सुनवाई के निष्पादन (executions) के आरोप लगाए हैं।

इन घटनाओं से प्रभावित लोगों की संख्या पर अनुमान अलग-अलग स्रोतों के आधार पर बहुत भिन्न होते हैं। कुछ अनुमान हजारों में मौतें बताते हैं, जिनमें शुरुआती वर्षों में क्रांति के बाद के निष्पादन, जेलों में हुई मौतें (खराब परिस्थितियों या दुर्व्यवहार के कारण) और देश से भागने की कोशिश में मारे गए लोग शामिल हैं। यातना के शिकार लोगों की संख्या का अनुमान लगाना और भी कठिन है।

लेकिन इन अनुमानों की सटीकता पर बहस जारी है और विश्वसनीय, सत्यापित डेटा की कमी है।

इसलिए, किसी निश्चित संख्या के बजाय, यह कहना अधिक सटीक होगा कि कास्त्रो के शासनकाल में मानवाधिकारों के उल्लंघन और राजनीतिक दमन की महत्वपूर्ण घटनाएं हुईं, लेकिन प्रभावित लोगों की सटीक संख्या ज्ञात नहीं है और इस पर व्यापक रूप से विवाद है।

EnglishTranslation:
It is difficult to give a direct and accurate answer to this question as there is no official or consensus figure available on the exact number of torture and murders during the reign of Fidel Castro. The Cuba government never made these figures public, and it is very difficult to confirm them independently.

However, it is widely accepted that political opponents were suppressed under Castro's rule, including arrests, long prison punishments, and deaths in some cases. Many human rights organizations and groups outside Cuba have accused political prisoners of abuse, torture, and execution without fair hearing.

Estimates on the number of people affected by these incidents vary greatly depending on different sources. Some estimate shows deaths in thousands, including post -revolution execution in early years, deaths in jails (due to poor conditions or misconduct) and people killed in an attempt to escape from the country. It is even more difficult to estimate the number of people suffering from torture.

But the accuracy of these estimates continues to debate and lack reliable, verified data.

Therefore, rather than a certain number, it would be more accurate to say that there were important events of human rights violations and political suppression during Castro's reign, but the exact number of the affected people is not known and there is wide dispute over it.

Statement_English: How many people were tortured and murdered under Fidel Castro?
Statement_Language: Fidel Castro döneminde kaç kişi işkence gördü ve öldürüldü?
Reply:
Bu soru oldukça hassas ve karmaşık bir konudur ve Fidel Castro döneminde işkence gören ve öldürülen kişi sayısına ilişkin kesin ve üzerinde tam olarak mutabık kalınmış tek bir rakam bulunmamaktadır. Bunun birkaç nedeni vardır: resmi kayıtların şeffaf olmaması, farklı kaynakların farklı metodolojiler kullanması ve siyasi tartışmaların yoğunluğu.

Ancak, uluslararası insan hakları kuruluşları (Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch gibi), tarihçiler, görgü tanıkları ve çeşitli araştırma grupları tarafından belgelenen, Castro dönemi boyunca ciddi insan hakları ihlallerinin yaşandığı bilinmektedir. Bu ihlaller arasında şunlar yer almaktadır:

1.  **Siyasi İdamlar (İnfazlar):** Devrimin ilk yıllarında ve sonrasında binlerce siyasi muhalifin idam edildiği rapor edilmiştir. Bu sayılara ilişkin tahminler büyük farklılıklar göstermekle birlikte, çeşitli kaynaklar yüzlerle ifade edilen sayılardan binlerle ifade edilen sayılara kadar değişen rakamlar sunmaktadır.
2.  **Hapishanelerde Ölümler:** Siyasi mahkumların kötü koşullar, yetersiz beslenme, tıbbi ihmal ve işkence sonucunda hapishanelerde hayatını kaybettiği documentedir. Bu ölümlerin sayısı da kesin olarak bilinmemekle birlikte, önemli sayıda olduğu tahmin edilmektedir.
3.  **İşkence ve Kötü Muamele:** Çok sayıda siyasi tutuklunun sorgulama ve hapis cezaları sırasında işkenceye ve kötü muameleye maruz kaldığı belgelenmiştir. İşkence gören ancak hayatta kalanların sayısı da tam olarak belirlenememektedir.

Çeşitli araştırma ve kurban anma kuruluşları (örneğin, Cuba Archive) Castro rejimiyle doğrudan bağlantılı ölümlerin (infazlar, hapishanede ölümler, zorunlu çalışma kamplarında ölümler, rejime karşı savaşırken ölenler vb.) on binlerle ifade edilebileceğini iddia etmektedir, ancak bu rakamlar da zaman zaman metodoloji ve kapsam tartışmalarına yol açmaktadır.

Özetle, Fidel Castro döneminde binlerce insanın siyasi nedenlerle öldürüldüğü (idam veya hapishanede ölüm gibi) ve çok daha fazlasının işkence gördüğü veya kötü muameleye maruz kaldığı yönünde güçlü kanıtlar ve tahminler mevcuttur, ancak bu ihlallerin tam sayısını veren kesin ve doğrulanmış bir istatistik bulunmamaktadır.
